intro: Psilocaulon asperulum, commonly known as the rough psilocaulon, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its hairy, woody stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine pubescence. While not psychoactive, it is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
